        void placeInFrontOfEntity(IEntity entity,
                          float distance)

      • setVelocity

        void setVelocity(float velocity)
        Modifies the velocity. Velocity can not be zero if you need to check if the projectile is not moving, Do something like if (proj.getVelocity() < 0.001. Any more zeroes and it may wrongly return false.
        Parameters:
        velocity -

      • getType

        int getType()
        Gets the entity's type. See com.veil.extendedscripts.constants.EntityType.
        Returns:
        com.veil.extendedscripts.constants.EntityType#PROJECTILE

      • getDoesVelocityAddDamage

        boolean getDoesVelocityAddDamage()

      • setDoesVelocityAddDamage

        void setDoesVelocityAddDamage(boolean doesVelocityAddDamage)
        Normal projectiles like arrows scale damage based on velocity. If you want consistent damage, set to false.

      • getID

        int getID()

      • setID

        void setID(int id)
        Sets the ID. This ID is used in ICustomProjectileImpactEvent and ICustomProjectileTickEvent. Multiple projectiles can share ids. ID will be 0 if not specified.

      • getOwner

        IEntity getOwner()

      • setOwner

        void setOwner(IEntity owner)
        Set the owner of the projectile. When the projectile does damage, it uses this entity for the IDamageSource.

      • getMCEntity

        EntityCustomProjectile getMCEntity()
        For expert use only.

      • getIEntity

        IEntity getIEntity()
        Due to certain limitations, you can not directly call IEntity's methods on ICustomProjectile. Instead, you can call them on this object.
